title: Proposal of Collaboration Safety in a Coexistence Environment of Human and Robots
aff: Mr. Masao Dohi was born in Hyogo Prefecture, Japan, in 1965. He received his B.S. in physics in 1988 from Kobe University. He joined IDEC Corporation in 1988, where he engaged in R&D on semiconductor devices. Since 1999 he conducted product development on industrial networking devices, RF-ID equipment, and functional safety products. Since 2010, he had led the International Standardization and Safety Solution Center, and then he has led the international Standardization Division in R&D Strategy HQ. His expertise ranges widely from, machinery safety, functional safety, explosion-proof technology, human machine interface, robotics, industrial automation, field networks, and to fine bubble technology. He possesses in-depth knowledge of IEC and ISO international standards, mainly in the fields of safety and industrial automation, and is belonging to various activities related to standardization. He was awarded the achievement award by the Japan Robot Association (JARA) in 2017 for his contribution to the standardization committee and the planning committee in JARA.; Mr. Kazuya Okada was born in Wakayama Prefecture, Japan, in 1966. He received his B.S. in Department of Electronics in 1991 from Doshisya University. He joined IDEC Corporation in 1991, where started a career as an engineer of control and safety. he is a consultant about safety related system, risk Assessment and lecturingto a our customers about Machinery and Electrical Safety. He is a member of IEC 62737 as a Japanese representative for the international committee. And he has a master's degree in System Safety. He received it in Professional Degree Course of System Safety in 2010 in Nagaoka University of Technology.; Mr. Ikuo Maeda was born in Hyogo Prefecture, Japan, in 1965. He received his B.S. in Metallurgical Engineering in 1988 from Himeji Institute of Technology (University of Hyogo). Since joining IDEC in 1988, he has worked in product certification and risk assessment projects, while leveraging his expertise in international, European, and North American standards and regulations of machine, control, safety, and explosion protection fields. He also engages in standardization activities of control, safety, robot, explosion protection, functional safety technologies and semiconductor equipment etc. Mr. Maeda is an expert member of lEC ACOS.; Shigetoshi Fujitani; Dr. Toshihiro Fujita was born in Osaka, Japan, in 1955. He received his B.S. in 1977, M.S. in 1980, and Ph.D. in 1988 in applied physics from Osaka University. He joined the Central Research Laboratory, Matsushita Electric Industrial Co. Ltd. (Panasonic) in 1980, where he engaged in R&D on optical fiber communication systems, optical amplifiers, and optical disc recording device technologies. He was a visiting fellow from 1986 to 1987 at Cornell University, NY, USA, where he conducted spectroscopic research on bistability and short-pulse generation by utilizing semiconductor lasers. Since joining IDEC in 1992, he has led the R&D and technology departments. His expertise ranges widely from industrial automation, factory networking, safety/explosion-proof equipment, human machine interface, sensors, photonics, robotics and to ultrafine and fine bubble application. He received the METI Minister's awards of the FY2013 industrial standardization awards. He is a member of IEEE, ISA, the Human Interface Society Japan, and so forth. He is also a scientific committee member of the international conference on the Safety of Industrial Automated Systems (SIAS).
